ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Byzantine art is a pretty straight forward survey of Middle Byzantine churches and manuscripts. Take it if you're interested in the period, or want to study a lot of images of Mary and the Christ child! It's also a great way to school yourself in Christian iconography!
Very enjoyable despite the work load

It is an excellent introduction to Byzantine art. You will look at beautiful artworks from 850 to 13th century from Constantinople, Greece, Sicily and Venice. It is a pleasure to sit in the lectures, but it is a demanding course. I would highly recommend this course for students interested in byzantine art who are ready to work very regularly for this course. It was a wonderful course!

An intense course covering what a student interested in Byzantium needs to know. It provides you with the basic skills one needs to approach Byzantine art while offering insightful approaches through select articles of renowned Byzantine scholars. Would definitely recommend the course.
